# Using R to make movies

While most of the visualizations made in R are `static`, with a single image 
displaying the data, one can also make videos in R. These are particularly 
useful when data has a temporal component or a third axis for display. Here
we will show a few ways to make videos using R and airport weather data 

```{r setup, include=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
library(riem) # Precipitation data
library(animation) #movie making
library(USAboundaries) # boundary data
library(gganimate) #another way to make movies
library(lubridate)
library(ggthemes)
library(tmap)
library(sf)
library(gifski)
library(USAboundariesData)
theme_set(theme_few()) # Set ggplot theme


knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
```


# Data acquisition and reshaping


## Finding our station names

```{r, include = FALSE}
#riem_networks() # look for network names

co_stations <- riem_stations(network = 'CO_ASOS')

#View(co_stations)

stations <- c('AFF', 'FNL')

```

## Download station data

```{r, include = FALSE}

af_p <- riem_measures(station='AFF',date_start = '2018-10-01',
                      date_end = '2019-09-30')


fc <- riem_measures(station='FNL',date_start = '2018-10-01',
                      date_end = '2019-09-30')

View(fc)
```


## Convert both to daily

```{r, include = FALSE}

daily_p <- fc %>% 
  bind_rows(af_p) %>%
  mutate(date = as.Date(valid)) %>%
  group_by(date, station, lon, lat) %>%
  summarize(mean_temp = mean(tmpf,na.rm=T),
            min_temp = min(tmpf,na.rm=T),
            max_temp = max(tmpf,na.rm=T),
            daily_p = sum(p01i,na.rm=T)) %>%
  as.data.frame() %>%
  as_tibble()

```


# Making videos 

## Boring first video

```{r, eval=FALSE}

slice_p <- daily_p %>%
  slice(1:20)

p1 <- ggplot(slice_p,aes(x=date,y=mean_temp,color=station,group=station)) + 
  geom_point() +
  labs(title = 'Date: {frame_time}', x='Date',y= 'Mean Temp (f)') + 
  transition_time(date) 


animate(p1, nframes=nrow(slice_p))


```


## Leaving a trace

```{r, eval = FALSE}
p2 <- ggplot(daily_p,aes(x=date,y=mean_temp,color=station,group=station)) + 
  geom_line() + 
  geom_point() +
  labs(title = '100 mile temp diff', x='Date',y= 'Mean Temp (f)')+
  transition_reveal(date) + 
  scale_color_few()

animate(p2, nframes=nrow(daily_p))
```


## Static background plot

```{r, include = FALSE}
usa <- us_states()

co <- usa %>%
  filter(name == 'Colorado')

sf_p <- daily_p %>%
  st_as_sf(coords=c('lon','lat'),crs=4326)


co_elev <- elevatr::get_elev_raster(co,z=6)

tm_shape(co) + 
  tm_polygons() + 
  tm_shape(co_elev) +
  tm_raster(style='cont',palette = 'Greens') + 
  tm_shape(sf_p) + 
  tm_dots(col='station',size=3,palette=c('red','white'))

```

## Quick plot
```{r, include = FALSE}
basemap <- tm_shape(co) + 
    tm_polygons() + 
  tm_shape(co_elev) +
    tm_raster(style='cont',
              palette = 'Greens',
              title='Elevation (m)') 
```


```{r,eval=F}
 
full_dates <- unique(sf_p$date)

sequence <- 1:10
  # 
  # length(full_dates)
saveGIF({
  for(i in sequence){
  sub_sf <- sf_p %>%
    filter(date == full_dates[i]) %>%
    filter(daily_p > 0)
  

  if(nrow(sub_sf) > 0){
  finalmap <- basemap + tm_shape(sub_sf) + 
    tm_dots(col='station',
            size=2,
            palette = c('red','white'),
            legend.show = F) 
  }else{finalmap <- basemap}
  print(finalmap + 
          tm_layout(title=full_dates[i]) + 
          tm_add_legend(type='symbol',
                        labels=c('Air Force',
                                 'Fort Collins'),
                        col=c('red','white'),
                        title='Station'))
  }
},movie.name = 'precip_flash.gif',
  interval=0.05,
  ani.width=1000,
  ani.height=800)


```

# A cooler video

## Let's see if we can see weather fronts by downloading all Colorado data and
trying to get those to flash


```{r,eval=F}

all_co <- map(co_stations$id,~riem_measures(.x,date_start='2018-10-01',
                                         date_end = '2019-09-30'))
stack_co <- do.call('rbind',all_co)

daily_p <- stack_co %>% 
  mutate(date = as.Date(valid)) %>%
  group_by(date, station, lon, lat) %>%
  summarize(mean_temp = mean(tmpf,na.rm=T),
            min_temp = min(tmpf,na.rm=T),
            max_temp = max(tmpf,na.rm=T),
            daily_p = sum(p01i,na.rm=T)) %>%
  as.data.frame() %>%
  as_tibble()

save(daily_p,file='DailyP.RData')
```

## Full state video

This code is almost identical to the above, but it uses all ASOS/AWOS precip
stations

```{r, eval=F}
load('DailyP.RData')

daily_sf <- daily_p %>%
  st_as_sf(.,coords=c('lon','lat'),crs=4326,remove=F)

full_dates <- unique(daily_sf$date)

sequence <- 1:10
  # length(full_dates)
saveVideo({
  for(i in sequence){
  sub_sf <- daily_sf %>%
    filter(date == full_dates[i]) %>%
    filter(daily_p > 0)

  if(nrow(sub_sf) > 0){
  finalmap <- basemap + tm_shape(sub_sf) +
    tm_dots(title.size='Daily Precip (in)',
            col='lon',
            size='daily_p',
            style='cont',
            palette='Oranges',
            legend.show = F,
            size.max=19,
            scale=3.5,
            sizes.legend=c(0,1,5,10,20))
  }else{finalmap <- basemap}
  print(finalmap +
          tm_layout(title=full_dates[i],
        legend.position=c(0.7,0.2)))
  }
},movie.name = 'precip_flash_all.mp4',
  interval=0.12,
  ani.width=1000,
  ani.height=800)
```


# In Class work.

## GGanimate

Make a video showing the correlation between Air Force Academy and Fort Collins
between the min, mean, and max temps. The movie should cover the full year. 

```{r, warning = FALSE}
daily_p_type<-daily_p%>%
  group_by(station)%>%
  gather(key=type, value= value, mean_temp:max_temp)%>%
  select(-lon, -lat, -daily_p)%>%
  group_by(date, type)%>%
  spread(station, value)
  
slice_p_type <- daily_p_type %>%
  arrange(date) %>%
  slice(1:20)

p4<-ggplot(daily_p_type,aes(x=FNL,y=AFF,color=type)) + 
  geom_point() +
  geom_line()+
  labs(title = 'Min, Max, Mean Temp Compare', x='Temp FNL (f)',y= 'Temp AFF (f)')+
  transition_reveal(date) + 
  scale_color_few()

animate(p4, nframes=nrow(daily_p_type))

```

## (Animation package)

Make a video of mean temperature differences for the full Colorado dataset
(you need to download this [here](https://www.dropbox.com/s/s7zt18elgoh8q2b/DailyP.RData?dl=0)) first.

The video should look similar to the one above, but I want you to choose your own 
style (change the background, add other layers (like counties or cities)), etc...

### Load data and create basemap
```{r}
load('DailyP.RData')

co_cities <- us_cities(states = "CO")

sf_p <- daily_p %>%
  st_as_sf(coords=c('lon','lat'),crs=4326)

tm_shape(co) + 
   tm_polygons() + 
   tm_shape(co_elev) +
   tm_raster(style = 'cont',
             palette = 'YlOrRd',
             title = 'Elevation (m)')+    
  tm_shape(co_cities) +
   tm_dots(size = 'population')+
   # tm_shape(sf_p) + 
   # tm_dots(col='station',size=3,palette=c('red','white'))+
 tm_layout(scale = 1, 
 	legend.position = c("left","bottom"),
     legend.bg.color = "white", legend.bg.alpha = .7, 
     legend.frame = "gray50")
 
basemap <- tm_shape(co) +
   tm_polygons() +
   tm_shape(co_elev) +
   tm_raster(style = 'cont',
             palette = 'YlOrRd',
             title = 'Elevation (m)') +
   tm_layout(legend.position = c("left", "bottom"),
             bg.color = "lightblue") +
   tm_shape(co_cities) +
   tm_dots(size = 'population')+
   tm_layout(scale = 1, 
	legend.position = c("left","bottom"),
     legend.bg.color = "white", legend.bg.alpha = .7, 
     legend.frame = "gray50")

```

### Make video
```{r}
daily_sf <- daily_p %>%
  st_as_sf(.,coords=c('lon','lat'),crs=4326,remove=F)

full_dates <- unique(sf_p$date)

sequence <- 1:10
  # length(full_dates)
saveGIF({
  for(i in sequence){
  sub_sf <- daily_sf %>%
    filter(date == full_dates[i]) %>%
    filter(daily_p > 0)

  if(nrow(sub_sf) > 0){
  finalmap <- basemap + tm_shape(sub_sf) + 
    tm_dots(title.size='Daily Precip (in)',
            col='lon',
            size='daily_p',
            style='cont',
            palette='Dark2',
            legend.show = F,
            size.max=10,
            scale=3.5,
            sizes.legend=c(0,1,5,10,20))
  }else{finalmap <- basemap}
  print(finalmap + 
          tm_layout(title=full_dates[i],
        legend.position=c(0.7,0.2)))
  }
},movie.name = 'precip_flash_all_2.gif',
  interval=0.12,
  ani.width=1000,
  ani.height=800)
```
